item.title: Metadata-Driven Design Patterns: A Comprehensive Guide
item.description: In modern software development, metadata-driven design patterns have emerged as a powerful approach to building flexible, maintainable, and scalable systems. By leveraging metadata—data that describes other data—these patterns enable developers to externalize configurations, automate repetitive tasks, and dynamically adapt system behavior. This article explores the core concepts, use cases, benefits, and challenges of metadata-driven design.
